DOC.brief_summary: Intranasal dexmedetomidine has shown to be an effective sedative when used prior to anaesthetic induction as premedication. 1mcg/kg intranasal dexmedetomidine was used in previous study and it produced satisfactory sedation in more than 50% of the children at the time of anaesthetic induction with no adverse effect. In this study we aim to compare 1mcg/kg with 2mcg/kg intranasal dexmedetomidine in children. We expect more children would attain satisfactory sedation prior to anaesthetic induction when higher dose is used.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Two Doses of Intranasal Dexmedetomidine as Premedication in Children
DOC.criteria: Age 112 years old American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) 12 Elective surgery Children with autism or pervasive personality disorder American Society of Anaesthesiologists (ASA) 35 Allergy or hypersensitive reaction to dexmedetomidine Known cardiac arrhythmia or congenital heart disease Mentally disabled
